title: Quinoa Kale Goat Cheese Salad
description: Quick salad, good warm or cold
story: Delicious and interesting salad, which you can make quite quickly. May be served warm, but is very good cold as well.</br></br>I like it with some goat cheese, but cheese may be skipped if you are not a fan.</br></br>Most of the cooking time is taken by preparing quinoa and it definitely can be done in advance.

ingredients.name: Quinoa
ingredients.preparationNotes: I prefer regular yellow one for this salad

ingredients.name: Dried cherries
ingredients.preparationNotes: may be substituted with dried cranberries

instructions: Cook quinoa as it says on a packaging. I usually boil 2 cups of water (in a heavy pot), add 1 cup of quinoa. Cook for 15 min. Season with some salt and either a dash of olive oil or some butter. Take off the stove and leave in a pot for another 15 min covered
Meanwhile, wash and dry kale. Remove hard stems, and shop quite finely. Transfer to a bowl, add a pinch of salt and squeeze kale using your hands - it will make it a little bit softer.
Dice your avocados, add to the kale.
Add dried cherries and roasted pine nuts.
For the seasoning: mix a juice of one lemon, olive oil, mustard and maple syrup, ground pepper and a pinch of salt. Mix well. Season the salad.
I usually serve goat cheese on a side.
